reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OMG....COULD NOT PUT THIS DOWN!!
reviews.reviewText: you can relate to EVERYTHING,,AND EVERYBODY IN THIS BOOK. You cannot put this down once you start reading..Mops is incredible..thank you David M Salkin!! , Carl and the Seal Teams, and all service members for your service! 🅱⚓🙏

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I was very surprised when I read this as it was much better than I thought it would be. For some reason the name didn't catch my interest but I decided to read it anyway.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Salkin at his finest.
reviews.reviewText: Murder, mayhem, suspense and good guys vs bad guys. Salkin knows how to write. His books keep you on the edge of your seat! THE MOP is brilliant from start to finish. Heart pounding suspense, and missions all over the globe. Will the good guys save the world?? Can they reach their destination in time?? You won't know until the very end. A MUST read in THE TEAM series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars an explosive story...couldn't put it down
reviews.reviewText: Loved it! I was on the edge of my seat until the very end...Great characters to love and hate...twists, turns, gritty story, and action packed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2017
Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2009
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Scary thought -- but a fun read
reviews.reviewText: THE MOP begins with a series of attacks on American soil by a new Muslim villain set on out-doing Osama Bin Laden. The US President and his team race to discover where and when the next bombing will take place. It's up to a small top secret group to do America's dirty work and stop the bad guys before the country is destroyed. The result is enough to scare the pants off just about anyone who picks up this novel.The book is compelling and the reader will race through the material in one or two sittings. Most of the characters are thinly drawn and hard to like. However, the story is plot driven and the cast is too vast to develop easily. Salkin would need a TV mini-series to do that. However, he employs a clever technique to make it all work - he uses the "ripped from the headlines" approach that allows the imagination to fill in the blanks. Omar Haq is the epitome of American ideas about hypocritical Arabic terrorists - and then some. Politicians act like politicians who must answer to a divided and frightened nation. The intelligence agencies and the military do their jobs with great skill. The unknown agents who go alone into danger are heroic and isolated. The SEALS act like SEALS, Sea Captains are crotchety and defiant, and in the end ... well, I won't tell you about the endingThe cover on this book is creative. A mop and a rifle - rendered in grayscale with a touch of bloody red -- foreshadow the content of the book and encourage passersby to pick it up and flip through the pages.THE MOP puts the reader in a bad spot - no one wants to believe the horrible situations created by the author. The violence is brutal and ugly to behold - like "24" on steroids. On the other hand, it's a difficult book to put down. Perhaps we want to believe that there is someone out there who can duke it out with the bad guys - and we don't have to know about their awful deeds or worry about their safety. They are guardian ghosts that move among us unseen.David Salkin is a solid, technical writer. Fans of the Thriller genre will enjoy the ride - so will anyone who likes a fast-paced, readable novel on a lazy afternoon. A word of caution - the antics of Omar Haq will disgust and appall most everyone - men, women, Muslim, Christian, Jewish, left or right. He's that good old fashion villain that everyone loves to hate. However, if you are squeamish, this might not be the book for you.Joyce FaulknerPresident of Military Writers Society of AmericaMWSAPresident@gmail.com

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2016
Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining quick read
reviews.reviewText: A very topical feel good rah rah story. All the bells and whistles of your CIA,Military adventure novels. Good characters, decent somewhat predictable plot. But who cares, it was a fun read.
